House, or cause the same to be inspected once
during each month, and report to the Mayor their
condition as to general good order and cleanliness,
as also, the number and condition of the caps,
rattles and other property of the city at each Station.
Sec. 4. He shall examine, or cause to be examined the several books kept in each Police Station House at least once during each month.
Sec. 5. He shall promptly report to the Mayor
all complaints made to him against the Officers
and Policemen.
Sec. 6. He shall keep in his office a book in
which shall be entered the name of every member
of the Police Department, together' with their
places of residence, their number and date of appointment. He shall, also, keep in his office a
book in which shall be entered all general and
special orders, stating the time the same were issued, said book to contain an index to the matter
referred to in said orders.
Sec. 7. He shall keep in his office a book alphabetically arranged, in which shall be entered
